input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Ability to speak english has a direct effect on diabetes and lifespan. Smoking has a direct effect on diabetes and lifespan. Diabetes has a direct effect on lifespan. Smoking is unobserved. The overall probability of speaking english is 8%. The probability of not speaking english and long lifespan is 63%. The probability of speaking english and long lifespan is 3%. Is the chance of long lifespan larger when observing speaking english?
